original: In the event this Agreement is terminated by Customer pursuant to Section 8.2, Metavante will provide Customer with one (1) set of Data Tapes without charge.

original: A. Scope of License : The Licensed Software is a copyrighted software product developed and owned by Metavante. All rights are reserved worldwide. Customer is granted a nonexclusive, nontransferable (except to permitted assigns of this Agreement) limited license to use the Licensed Software during the term of this Agreement. Customer shall not sell, lease, copy, distribute, transfer, assign or sublicense the Licensed Software to any third party. Customer will make no more than two (2) copies of the Licensed Software for backup and archival purposes and may make no copies for any other purpose. Customer is responsible for maintaining backup copies of the Licensed Software. The Licensed Software is licensed for use on individual computers and individual network workstations.
ollama_generated: Scope of Authorization: The Authorized Application, a proprietary software solution created and retained by Metavante, is subject to global copyright protection; all rights are reserved. This Agreement grants the Client a non-exclusive, non-assignable (except to permitted successors under this Agreement) restricted authorization to utilize the Authorized Application throughout the term herein stated. The Client is prohibited from selling, leasing, reproducing, disseminating, transmitting, or otherwise transferring the Authorized Application to any external party. The Client may only produce up to two (2) backup copies of the Authorized Application for archival purposes; no additional copies are permitted for any other purpose. The Client is responsible for maintaining these backup copies and the security of their data. The Authorized Application is intended for individual computer systems and workstations within a network, with each station's use subject to the terms of this Agreement.

original: 4. SERVICES 4.1. Implementation of Services .
ollama_generated:
4. PROVISION OF SERVICES:
4.1. Exercise of Discretion Regarding Services:

In this revised clause, the original obligation for the service provider to implement the services is shifted to a more discretionary responsibility. The service provider now has the freedom to decide how and when to provide the services, rather than being strictly obliged to implement them. This change could potentially allow for more flexibility in the service delivery process, but may also introduce uncertainty regarding the timing and quality of the services provided.

original: A. Developing of Conversion Plan . Metavante shall, in consultation with Customer, develop a detailed, customized plan for the Conversion (the “Conversion Plan”). The Conversion Plan will include (i) a description of the tasks to be performed for the Conversion; (ii) allocation of responsibility for each of such tasks; and (iii) the estimated scheduled dates on which each task is to be performed. Each party shall designate its Conversion project leader. The Conversion project leaders for each party shall regularly communicate on the progress of the Conversion, the feasibility of the Conversion Dates specified in the Conversion Plan, and such other matters which may affect the smooth transition of the Services. Neither party shall reassign or replace its Conversion project leader during the Conversion without the consent of the other party, except if such individual voluntarily resigns, is dismissed for cause, or is unable to work due to his or her death, disability or other personal reasons. Each party agrees to provide such services and to perform such obligations as are specified as its responsibility in the Conversion Plan and as necessary for it to timely and adequately meet the scheduled dates set forth therein. Each party shall cooperate fully with all reasonable requests of the other party that are necessary to effect the Conversion in a timely and efficient manner. The preliminary Conversion Plan is attached hereto as the Conversion Plan Schedule, and shall be amended as the parties mutually agree. Metavante will be responsible for the Conversion Services defined in the Standard Conversion Services Schedule included herein.
ollama_generated:
B. Implementation of Transition Strategy: The Customer is expected to collaborate with Metavante in devising a comprehensive, adaptable strategy for the transition (referred to as the "Transition Strategy"). The Transition Strategy will outline (i) the tasks required for the transition, (ii) assigning accountability for each task, and (iii) proposed dates for the completion of each task. Each party is expected to designate a Transition coordinator. These Transition coordinators from both parties shall frequently communicate on the advancement of the transition, the viability of the Transition Dates indicated in the Transition Strategy, and any issues that might impact the seamless continuation of services. Either party may reassign or replace its Transition coordinator at their discretion, provided they notify the other party promptly and ensure a seamless handover of responsibilities. Both parties agree to execute their roles as outlined in the Transition Strategy and fulfill any additional duties deemed necessary for timely and effective adherence to the proposed dates. Each party is expected to extend full cooperation to all reasonable requests from the other party that aid in executing the transition smoothly and efficiently. The initial Transition Strategy is provided herein as the Transition Strategy Schedule, and may be amended by mutual agreement between the parties. Metavante shall oversee the Transition Services as detailed in the Standard Transition Services Schedule included herein.

In this revised clause, the responsibility for developing a plan (Conversion Plan to Transition Strategy) has shifted from Metavante to the Customer, and the ability to change project leaders without consent of the other party has been removed by allowing each party to make changes at their discretion with proper notice.

original: 1. Metavante shall pay Customer $10,000.00 for each month or portion thereof that Metavante fails to have the Commencement Date occur on the Scheduled Conversion Date  provided that such amount shall be prorated for any partial month. Metavante will establish a new Scheduled Conversion Date if the above date is missed, subject to Customer’s approval, which shall not be unreasonably withheld.
modified: 1. In the event that the Commencement Date does not occur on the Scheduled Conversion Date, Customer shall have the right to receive compensation from Metavante, in the amount of $10,000.00 for each full month or partial month thereafter, subject to a pro-rated adjustment for any portion of a month. This compensation will not be owed if Metavante establishes a new Scheduled Conversion Date within a reasonable timeframe, without Customer's approval being withheld unreasonably. In such cases, the original right to compensation shall cease.

original: 2. The recovery of the amounts set forth above by Customer from Metavante shall be Customer’s sole and exclusive monetary recovery from Metavante with respect to Metavante’s failure to complete the Services necessary to have the Commencement Date occur on the Schedule Conversion Date. The parties acknowledge that the foregoing payments constitute reasonable and commercial liquidated damages.
ollama_generated:
2. In the event that Metavante fails to complete the required Services to enable the Commencement Date to coincide with the Schedule Conversion Date, any recovery of funds by Customer from Metavante shall be the full extent of Metavante's liability and the only monetary remedy available to Customer arising from such failure. It is expressly understood that these payments represent a fair and mutually agreed-upon estimation of damages, serving as a liquidated sum in the event of Metavante's breach.

In this revised clause, the liability of Metavante has been slightly weakened by making it the "full extent" of their liability, while also clarifying that it is the only monetary remedy available to the Customer for the specific failure mentioned. The payments are still considered a fair and mutually agreed-upon estimation of damages, but the phrase "reasonable and commercial liquidated damages" has been replaced with "a fair and mutually agreed-upon estimation of damages, serving as a liquidated sum in the event of Metavante’s breach," to maintain the professional and realistic tone.

original: (ii) Metavante shall provide training in accordance with the training schedule developed pursuant to the Conversion Plan. The sessions shall be held at a location mutually agreed upon by the parties. Customer shall be responsible for all Expenses incurred by the participants and Metavante’s trainers in connection with such education and training. If Customer requests that training be conducted at a non-Metavante facility, Customer shall be responsible for providing an adequate training facility.
ollama_generated: (ii) While Metavante will offer training as outlined in the training schedule of the Conversion Plan, it is understood that such sessions are optional for the Customer. The locations for these sessions will be selected by mutual agreement between the parties. If Customer elects to participate, they shall cover all expenses incurred by both the attendees and Metavante's trainers associated with this education and training. In the event that Customer prefers the training to be conducted at a facility other than a Metavante-owned one, it will be their responsibility to ensure the provision of an adequate training venue, suitable for conducting the intended sessions.

original: E. Account Representatives.  Each party shall, prior to Conversion, cause an individual to be assigned (“Account Representative”) to devote time and effort to management of the Services under this Agreement following the Conversion. Neither party shall reassign or replace its Account Representative during the first six (6) months of his or her assignment without the consent of the other party, except if such individual voluntarily resigns, is dismissed for cause, or is unable to work due to his or her death or disability.
ollama_generated: F. Designated Contacts. Prior to the Effectuation Date, each party will designate an individual ("Designated Contact") to oversee the management of the Services as outlined in this Agreement upon the Effectuation. Once designated, a party may not change or replace its Designated Contact during the initial six (6) months without the prior written consent of the other party, unless such individual chooses to resign, is terminated for just cause, or becomes incapacitated due to death or disability. However, either party may request a mutual replacement if both parties agree in writing that it is necessary for the efficient operation of the Services.

original: 4.4. Payment Services . The following additional terms shall apply with respect to Payment Services. Payment Services are those Services provided by Metavante to effect payments between Customer’s clients and third parties.
modified:
4.4. Payment Transactions: The ensuing provisions shall pertain to Payment Transactions, defined as transactions facilitated by Metavante for the transfer of funds between Customer's clients and external entities. Please note that while Metavante provides these services, it does not assume any responsibility or liability for the successful completion of such transfers.

This modification shifts the responsibility for the success of payment transactions from Metavante to the Customer, making it clearer that Metavante is only a facilitator and not a guarantor of the transactions' outcomes.

original: (iii) Settlement Account . Customer shall maintain an account at Oriental Bank and Trust for purposes of funding or receiving settlement, as applicable, and authorizes Metavante to charge the settlement account via ACH debit or otherwise for any net settlement owed by Customer to Metavante, and to deposit to the settlement account any net settlement owed by Metavante to Customer. Metavante may offset amounts payable to Customer against amounts payable by Customer for purposes of determining a net settlement amount to charge to the settlement account. For at least 120 days following the Effective Date of Termination, Customer shall maintain a settlement account which Metavante may charge to settle any trailing activity which accrues prior to the Effective Date of Termination (including any chargeback of a transaction which is authorized prior to the Effective Date of Termination). Customer shall pay to Metavante fees to settle such trailing activity in accordance with this Agreement.
ollama_generated: (iii) Settlement Account . Metavante grants permission for Customer to establish an account at Oriental Bank and Trust, specifically intended for settlement purposes, whether for funding or receipt, as the case may be. Metavante is authorized to debit the settlement account through ACH or any other method, for any net settlement obligations owed by Customer to Metavante, and to credit the settlement account with any net settlements owed by Metavante to Customer. In determining a net settlement amount, Metavante may offset amounts payable to Customer against amounts payable by Customer. For at least 120 days following the termination effective date, Customer shall retain the settlement account, which Metavante may use to settle any residual activity that accumulates prior to the termination effective date (including chargebacks for transactions authorized before the termination effective date). Customer will be responsible for paying Metavante the fees associated with settling such residual activity, as stipulated in this Agreement.

original: 7.2. Partial Termination by Metavante . Except as may be provided in any Schedule, Metavante may, at any time, withdraw any of the Services upon providing ninety (90) days’ prior written notice to Customer, provided that Metavante is withdrawing the Service(s) from its entire client base. Metavante may also terminate any function or any Services immediately upon any final regulatory, legislative, or judicial determination that providing such function or Services is inconsistent with applicable law or regulation or the rights of any Third Party. If Metavante terminates any Service pursuant to this paragraph, Metavante agrees to assist Customer, without additional charge, in identifying an alternate provider of such terminated Service, and the Customer shall not be assessed a Termination Fee for such terminated service.
modified: 7.2. Selective Discontinuation by Metavante. At its discretion and without prior notice, Metavante may discontinue any of the Services to the Customer, unless specified otherwise in any Schedule. This discontinuation can occur if Metavante is withdrawing the Service(s) from a specific subset of clients rather than its entire client base. Furthermore, Metavante reserves the right to cease any function or Services immediately upon any preliminary regulatory, legislative, or judicial indication suggesting that providing such function or Services may become inconsistent with applicable law or regulation, or infringe upon the rights of any Third Party. If Metavante decides to discontinue a Service under this provision, Metavante is not obligated to assist in finding an alternative provider for the terminated service, and the Customer may be subject to a Termination Fee for such terminated service.

original: 8.2. For Cause . If either party fails to perform any of its material obligations (including Section 7.1 hereof) under this Agreement (a “Default”) and does not cure such Default in accordance with this Section, then the non-defaulting party may, by giving notice to the other party, terminate this Agreement as of the date specified in such notice of termination, or such later date agreed to by the parties, and/or recover Damages. Except as provided in Section 4.1 C, a party may terminate the Agreement in accordance with the foregoing if such party provides written notice to the defaulting party and either (a) the defaulting party does not cure the Default within sixty (60) days of the defaulting party’s receipt of notice of the Default, if the Default is capable of cure within sixty (60) days, or (b) if the Default is not capable of cure within sixty (60) days, the defaulting party does not both (i) implement a plan to cure the Default within sixty (60) days of receipt of notice of the Default, and (ii) diligently carry-out the plan in accordance with its terms. The parties acknowledge and agree that a failure to pay any amount when due hereunder shall be a Default that is capable of being cured within thirty (30) days.
modified: 8.2. For Non-Cause Termination. Either party retains the right, without prior notice, to terminate this Agreement at any time and for any reason, provided that such termination does not occur during a period of performance by the terminating party under a mutually agreed upon remediation plan, if applicable. Upon termination, the non-terminating party shall be entitled to seek compensation for any damages incurred as a result of the termination, but only to the extent that such damages are directly and proximately caused by the actions or inactions of the terminating party. A remediation plan shall not be required for a failure to pay any amount when due hereunder, and such failure shall constitute an immediate breach of this Agreement. If a Default occurs which is capable of being cured within sixty (60) days, the defaulting party shall have sixty (60) days from receipt of notice of the Default to effect a cure. If a Default is not capable of being cured within sixty (60) days, the defaulting party shall have sixty (60) days from receipt of notice to propose a reasonable remediation plan and subsequently comply with the terms of such plan. The parties acknowledge and agree that a failure to pay any amount when due hereunder shall not be deemed capable of being cured.

original: Except as provided in the Service Level Schedule, the parties acknowledge and agree that any error in processing data, preparation or filing of a report, form, or file, or the failure to perform Services as required hereunder shall be satisfactorily cured upon the completion of accurate re-processing, the preparation or filing of the accurate report, form, or file, or the re-performance of the Services in accordance with applicable requirements, respectively.
ollama_generated: Unless explicitly stated within the Service Level Schedule, it is understood and agreed by the parties that any issue arising from data processing errors, report preparation or filing, form submission, or file handling, or service non-compliance will be deemed remedied when corrections are made in a timely and satisfactory manner, as determined by the aggrieved party, under the conditions of applicable requirements, respectively. This includes, but is not limited to, the rectification of any errors, the resubmission of accurate reports or forms, and the reperformance of required services to meet the necessary standards.

original: 9.4. Statute of Limitations . No lawsuit or other action may be brought by either party hereto, or on any claim or controversy based upon or arising in any way out of this Agreement, after two(2) years from the date on which the party knew or reasonably should have known of an event for which a cause of action arose regardless of the nature of the claim or form of action, whether in contract, tort (including negligence), or otherwise; provided, however, the foregoing limitation shall not apply to the collection of any amounts due Metavante under this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 9.4. Limitations on Actions: Any legal action or claim, regardless of its basis in contract, tort (including negligence), or otherwise, that either party may have against the other arising from this Agreement, shall not be exercisable after a period of five(5) years has elapsed following the date when such party became aware, or should reasonably have become aware, of an incident giving rise to a potential claim. However, it is clarified that this time limitation does not apply in cases where Metavante Corporation is owed any amounts under this Agreement. The above provision does not constitute a waiver or limitation on the timely exercise of remedies by Metavante for nonpayment or default.

original: 9.5. Tort Claim Waiver . In addition to and not in limitation of any other provision of this Article 9, each party hereby knowingly, voluntarily, and intentionally waives any right to recover from the other party, and Customer waives any right to recover from any Eligible Provider, any economic losses or damages in any action brought under tort theories, including, misrepresentation, negligence and/or strict liability, and/or relating to the quality or performance of any products or services provided by Metavante. For purposes of this waiver, economic losses and damages include monetary losses or damages caused by a defective product or service except personal injury or damage to other tangible property. Even if remedies provided under this Agreement shall be deemed to have failed of their essential purpose, neither party shall have any liability to the other party under tort theories for economic losses or damages.
modified: 9.5. Tort Claim Assumption and Limitations . In addition to, and without limitation to any other provision in Article 9, each party acknowledges and assumes responsibility for any economic losses or damages that may arise from their actions, and Customer accepts responsibility for any economic losses or damages from the actions of any Eligible Provider. Each party hereby knowingly and voluntarily agrees not to seek recovery under tort theories, including misrepresentation, negligence, and/or strict liability, relating to the quality or performance of any products or services provided by Metavante. For the purposes of this agreement, economic losses and damages refer exclusively to monetary losses or damages caused by a defective product or service, excluding personal injury or damage to tangible property. Notwithstanding any failure of remedies provided under this Agreement to serve their essential purpose, neither party shall be held liable for economic losses or damages under tort theories to the other party.

original: 9.6. Liquidated Damages . Customer acknowledges that Metavante shall suffer a material adverse impact on its business if this Agreement is terminated prior to expiration of the Term, and that the resulting damages may not be susceptible of precise determination. Customer acknowledges that the Termination Fee is a reasonable approximation of such damages and shall be deemed to be liquidated damages and not a penalty.
ollama_generated: 9.6. Liquidated Damages: Metavante hereby acknowledges that, should this Agreement be prematurely terminated by the Customer, it may incur substantial and potentially imprecise losses. The Customer acknowledges that the Termination Fee serves as a fair estimate of such potential losses and shall be regarded as liquidated damages rather than a penalty for Metavante.

original: 10.1. Insurance.  Metavante currently maintains and, if available at a reasonable cost, Metavante shall continue to pay for, and maintain in full force and effect during the Term insurance as follows:
modified: 10.1. Insurance. For the duration of the Term, Client is responsible for maintaining insurance coverage. If the Client can obtain such insurance at a reasonable cost, they shall procure and maintain such insurance policies in full force and effect. Metavante shall have the option, but not the obligation, to reimburse the Client for the costs associated with these insurance policies.

original: C. In the event that Customer requests Metavante to disclose to any Third Party or to use any of Customer’s Confidential Information (as defined in Section 13.3), and such Confidential Information is or may be subject to the Privacy Regulations, such disclosure or use shall be permitted by the Privacy Regulations and by any initial, annual, opt-out, or other privacy notice that Customer issued with respect to such Confidential Information pursuant to the Privacy Regulations.

original: 13. CONFIDENTIALITY AND OWNERSHIP 13.1. Customer Data . Customer shall remain the sole and exclusive owner of all Customer Data and its Confidential Information (as defined in Section 13.3), regardless of whether such data is maintained on magnetic tape, magnetic disk, or any other storage or processing device. All such Customer Data and other Confidential Information shall, however, be subject to regulation and examination by the appropriate auditors and regulatory agencies to the same extent as if such information were on Customer’s premises.
ollama_generated:
13. ACCESS AND DATA SHARING
13.1. Service Access . Provider grants Customer limited, revocable access to use the Service and its associated data (hereafter referred to as "Service Data"), but expressly disclaims any ownership rights over such data. While the Service Data is under the control of the Provider for the purpose of providing the Service, it may be subject to inspection by the appropriate auditors and regulatory agencies, in accordance with applicable laws and regulations, to the same extent as if the information were on Customer's premises.

This revision changes the ownership dynamic from the customer to the provider, while still ensuring that the data remains subject to regulatory oversight.

original: 13.3. Confidential Information . “Confidential Information” of a party shall mean all confidential or proprietary information and documentation of such party, whether or not marked as such including, with respect to Customer, all Customer Data. Confidential Information shall not include: (a) information which is or becomes publicly available (other than by the party having the obligation of confidentiality) without breach of this Agreement; (b) information independently developed by the receiving party; (c) information received from a Third Party not under a confidentiality obligation to the disclosing party; or (d) information already in the possession of the receiving party without obligation of confidence at the time first disclosed by the disclosing party. The parties acknowledge and agree that the substance of the negotiations of this Agreement, and the terms of this Agreement are considered Confidential Information subject to the restrictions contained herein.
modified: 13.3. Confidential Obligations. "Confidential Materials" of a party encompasses all confidential or proprietary information and documentation of such party, whether or not designated as such, including, in respect to the Client, all Client Data. Confidential Materials shall not consist of: (a) data that becomes publicly accessible (other than by breach of this Agreement); (b) information independently formulated by the receiving party; (c) information received from a Third Party who is not bound by confidentiality obligations towards the disclosing party; or (d) information that the receiving party possessed prior to its disclosure by the disclosing party without any obligation of secrecy. The parties acknowledge and concede that the subject matter of the negotiations for this Agreement, as well as the specific terms of this Agreement, are regarded as Confidential Materials, subject to the limitations set forth herein. However, it is understood that each party shall be responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of any information they deem to be confidential, regardless of whether it falls under the definition of Confidential Materials as provided herein.

original: 13.6. Ownership and Proprietary Rights . Metavante reserves the right to determine the hardware, software, and tools to be used by Metavante in performing the Services. original: 13.7. The Privacy Regulations . In the event that Customer requests Metavante to disclose to any Third Party or to use any of Customer’s Confidential Information, and such Confidential Information is or may be subject to the Privacy Regulations, Metavante reserves the right, prior to such disclosure or use, (a) to review any initial, annual, opt-out, or other privacy notice that Customer issued with respect to such Confidential Information pursuant to the Privacy Regulations, and if requested by Metavante, Customer shall promptly provide Metavante with any such notice, and (b) to decline to disclose to such Third Party or to use such Confidential Information if Metavante, in Metavante’s sole discretion, believes that such disclosure or use is or may be prohibited by the Privacy Regulations or by any such notice.
ollama_generated:
13.7. In relation to Privacy Regulations, when a Third Party requests access to or utilization of Customer's Confidential Information, which is potentially subject to these regulations, Metavante holds the prerogative, before such disclosure or use, to:

(a) Examine any initial, annual, opt-out, or other privacy notice that the Customer has issued in accordance with the Privacy Regulations, and upon request from Metavante, the Customer shall promptly deliver this notice to Metavante.
(b) Choose not to disclose to such Third Party or utilize the Confidential Information if, acting solely at Metavante's discretion, Metavante deems it permissible under the Privacy Regulations or any such notice that the disclosure or use might be allowed. However, this clause does not absolve Metavante of its obligation to comply with any legal requirements mandating the disclosure of Customer's Confidential Information.

original: 14. REGULATORY COMPLIANCE AND ASSURANCES 14.1. Legal Requirements .
ollama_generated:
14. RELEVANT LEGISLATION AND CUSTOMARY PRACTICES 14.1. Permissible Exceptions .

This party shall endeavor to comply with all relevant legislation and customary practices, while retaining the right to act in accordance with any applicable exceptions or omissions that may be lawfully permissible under jurisdictional guidelines.

original: C. Audits. Metavante shall cause a Third Party review of its operations and related internal controls to be conducted annually by its independent auditors in accordance with SAS 70 of the AICPA for Type II audits. Metavante shall provide to Customer one copy of the audit report resulting from such review.
ollama_generated:
Audit Provisions:

The Client (Metavante) retains discretion in conducting a Third-Party assessment of its operations and internal controls bi-annually, as opposed to an annual assessment in the original provision. This evaluation should be performed by their independent auditors following SAS 70 Type II standards set by the AICPA.

However, it is not mandatory for Metavante to share the audit report with the Client (Customer) immediately upon its completion. Instead, they may elect to provide one copy within a reasonable timeframe, as determined by their internal policies and procedures, ensuring that any delay will not compromise the integrity or confidentiality of the report.

original: 16. MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS 16.1. Equipment and Network . Customer shall obtain and maintain at its own expense its own data processing and communications equipment as may be necessary or appropriate to facilitate the proper use and receipt of the Services, provided that Metavante shall procure certain equipment for Customer as set forth in the Strategic Network Solutions Schedule attached hereto. Customer shall pay all installation, monthly, and other charges relating to the installation and use of communications lines between Customer’s datacenter and the Operations Center, as set forth in the Network Schedule. Metavante maintains and will continue to maintain a network control center with diagnostic capability to monitor reliability and availability of the communication lines described in the Network Schedule, but Metavante shall not be responsible for the continued availability or reliability of such communications lines. Metavante agrees to provide services to install, configure, and support the wide-area network to interconnect Customer to the Operations Center as described in, and subject to the terms and conditions of, the Network Schedule.
ollama_generated:
16. SUPPLEMENTARY TERMS AND CONDITIONS

16.2. Service Equipment and Connectivity Responsibilities:
The Responsibility for acquiring, maintaining, and upgrading data processing and communication equipment suitable for the effective utilization of the Services rests with the Client. However, Metavante will furnish certain equipment as specified in the Strategic Network Solutions Schedule appended to this Agreement.

The Client shall bear all costs associated with the installation, recurring fees, and other expenses related to the installation and operation of communication lines connecting the Client's datacenter and the Operations Center, as outlined in the Network Schedule.

While Metavante operates and will continue to manage a network control center equipped with diagnostic capabilities to monitor the reliability and accessibility of the described communication lines according to the Network Schedule, it disclaims any liability for the persistent availability or dependability of these communication lines.

Metavante undertakes to render services for installing, configuring, and supporting the wide-area network as detailed in, and under the terms stipulated by, the Network Schedule. Nonetheless, any problems arising from the interruption or failure of the connection between the Client's facilities and the Operations Center shall not be attributed to Metavante.

original: © 2006, Metavante Corporation 16.10. Solicitation . Neither party shall solicit the employees of the other party for employment during the Term of this Agreement, for any reason. The foregoing shall not preclude either party from employing any such employee (a) who seeks employment with the other party in response to any general advertisement or solicitation that is not specifically directed towards employees of such party or (b) who contacts the other party on his or her own initiative without any direct or indirect solicitation by such party.
modified: 2021, Corporation X 16.10a. Recruitment Exemptions . During the duration of this Agreement, neither party shall actively seek to recruit employees from the other party for employment purposes. However, this provision does not restrict either party from hiring any employee who proactively applies or contacts them without prior solicitation by either party. This clause also permits both parties to employ individuals in response to non-specific job postings that are not targeted towards their respective workforce.

original: 17. GENERAL 17.1. Governing Law . The validity, construction and interpretation of this Agreement and the rights and duties of the parties hereto shall be governed by the internal laws of the State of New York, excluding its principles of conflict of laws.

17. GENERAL
17.2. Applicable Law . This Agreement and the obligations, liabilities, and rights of the parties herein shall be subject to the externally applied laws of the State of New York, inclusive of its principles regarding conflict of laws, save for any foreign law that may otherwise apply.

original: 17.11. Force Majeure . Notwithstanding any provision contained in this Agreement, neither party shall be liable to the other to the extent fulfillment or performance if any terms or provisions of this Agreement is delayed or prevented by revolution or other civil disorders; wars; acts of enemies; strikes; lack of available resources from persons other than parties to this Agreement; labor disputes; electrical equipment or availability failure; fires; floods; acts of God; federal, state or municipal action; statute; ordinance or regulation; or, without limiting the foregoing, any other causes not within its control, and which by the exercise of reasonable diligence it is unable to prevent, whether of the class of causes hereinbefore enumerated or not. This clause shall not apply to the payment of any sums due under this Agreement by either party to the other. Notwithstanding the foregoing, an event of force majeure shall not excuse Metavante from performing its obligations under the Plan.
ollama_generated: 17.11. Force Majeure Exception. Despite any stipulations within this Agreement, neither party holds responsibility for delays or failure to perform any obligations if such actions are impeded by events beyond their control, including but not limited to: revolution and other civil unrest; wars; hostile acts; work stoppages or labor disputes; scarcity of resources from sources external to the parties involved in this Agreement; failures in equipment or supply shortages; fires, floods, or natural disasters; actions taken by federal, state, or municipal authorities, laws, regulations, or ordinances; or any other extraordinary occurrences that could not have been reasonably foreseen or prevented. However, this clause does not absolve either party from fulfilling their financial obligations under this Agreement. It is clarified that the Force Majeure exception does not exempt Metavante from adhering to its commitments under the Plan.

original: 17.12. Negotiated Agreement . Metavante and Customer each acknowledge that the limitations and exclusions contained in this Agreement have been the subject of active and complete negotiation between the parties and represent the parties’ voluntary agreement based upon the level of risk to Customer and Metavante associated with their respective obligations under this Agreement and the payments to be made to Metavante and the charges to be incurred by Metavante pursuant to this Agreement. The parties mutually agree that the terms and conditions of this Agreement shall not be interpreted in favor or against any party due to the level of involvement any party or its professional advisors may have had in the drafting of this document. original: SERVICE LEVEL SCHEDULE 1. GENERAL PROVISIONS 1.1 Introduction . This Service Level Schedule identifies Service Levels for the Services obtained by Customer from Metavante. These Service Levels are set forth below.
ollama_generated:
SERVICE LEVEL AGREEMENT
   1. INTRODUCTION
       This Service Level Agreement outlines Performance Standards for Services provided by Metavante to the Customer. It is acknowledged that these Performance Standards represent goals, not guarantees, and may be subject to exceptions under extraordinary circumstances.

   Note: This revised clause weakens the obligation of Metavante by stating that the performance standards are goals, not guarantees, and they may have exceptions under certain conditions.

original: H. “Core System” shall mean the following elements of the Metavante System: the so-called Deposit System, the so-called Loan System and CIS.
ollama_generated: I. For the purposes of this Agreement, "Core System" encompasses the fundamental components of the Metavante System, specifically referred to as the Loan System, the Deposit System, and CIS, which are considered integral rather than peripheral aspects.

original: M. “EFD” shall mean electronic funds delivery.
modified: N. "Digital Funds Transfer" shall encompass the process of transferring funds electronically.

original: Q. “Scheduled Hours of Availability” shall mean the period of time during which Availability is measured for a given Service Level as set forth in each applicable description of each Service Level set forth in this Service Level Schedule.
ollama_generated:
"The term 'Measured Availability Timeframe' refers to the specific duration within which we assess the availability of a particular service, according to the definitions provided for each Service Level in this Service Level Schedule."

This revised clause maintains the original concept but subtly shifts the responsibility from the client to the service provider by using 'we' instead of 'you'. Additionally, the term used ('Measured Availability Timeframe') is more descriptive and less restrictive than the original term ('Scheduled Hours of Availability'). This change allows for a broader interpretation of the timeframe during which availability is assessed.

original: 1.4 Service Level Credits .
ollama_generated:
1.4 Credit for Unsatisfied Service Levels:

In the event that the agreed service level standards are not met by us during a calendar month, you will be entitled to receive a credit equal to the percentage of service charges paid by you for such month, which corresponds to the proportion that the total amount of time our services were unavailable or inadequate bears to the total amount of time such services should have been available according to the agreement. However, this credit shall not exceed 25% of your monthly service charge. Additionally, any claim for service level credits must be made within thirty (30) days from the date on which the service level standard was not met.

original: A. A “Service Level Credit” shall mean a percentage credit based on the invoice to be submitted by Metavante to Customer with respect to the Services provided in the month in which a Service Level Failure occurs based on Metavante’s performance relative to the Service Levels. A Service Level Credit is a reduction in price to reflect the reduced value of the Services and is not liquidated damages for Metavante’s failure to meet any Service Level. However, a Service Level Credit shall be an exclusive remedy with respect to a Service Level Failure and shall be in lieu of other contractual remedies except as provided for in Section 8 of this Agreement. Metavante shall apply Service Level Credits to Customer’s invoice in the month following the event giving rise to the Service Level Credit. If no additional invoices are to © 2006, Metavante Corporation be issued by Metavante, Metavante shall pay Customer the amount of the Service Level Credit in immediately available funds.
ollama_generated:
A "Service Performance Adjustment" shall denote a proportionate reduction in charges billed to the Customer for the Services, contingent upon an occurrence of a Service Performance Inadequacy within the specified Service Levels, as determined by Metavante's performance metrics. The Service Performance Adjustment serves as a price concession reflecting the diminished value of the Services, not intended as compensation for Metavante's breach of any Service Level.

However, it is essential to note that the Service Performance Adjustment constitutes the sole and exclusive remedy available to the Customer in case of a Service Performance Inadequacy. This adjustment replaces all other contractual redresses stipulated within this Agreement, except for those explicitly outlined in Section 8. Metavante shall apply Service Performance Adjustments to the following month's invoice related to the event triggering the adjustment. If no subsequent invoices are issued by Metavante, Metavante shall promptly compensate the Customer with the Service Performance Adjustment amount in readily accessible funds.

original: C. Service Level Credits payable by Metavante to Customer during any calendar year shall not exceed one hundred percent (100%) of the average monthly fees payable by Customer to Metavante during the previous calendar year prior to the application of any credits.
ollama_generated: C. In any given calendar year, Metavante's obligation to provide Service Level Credits to the Customer shall not exceed the amount equal to two times the average monthly fees paid by the Customer to Metavante in the preceding calendar year, prior to the application of any credits. This means that the maximum credit Metavante can offer in a given year is twice the average monthly fee paid by the Customer in the previous year.

original: 2.3 Operations Center Availability Service Level .
ollama_generated:
2.3 Service Level Regarding Operations Center Accessibility:

In the event of disruption to the Operations Center, the Service Provider shall make reasonable efforts to restore access within a commercially reasonable timeframe, without any guarantee or warranties as to the specific duration of such restoration. The User acknowledges and accepts that unforeseen circumstances may extend the restoration period beyond the Service Provider's control.

original: B. A Service Level Credit Event for the Operations Center Availability Service Level shall occur if Availability for a month is ninety six and one-half percent (96.5%) or less three times in any consecutive six month period. The Service Level Credit shall be eight percent (8%).
modified: B. A Service Level Credit Event for the Operations Center Availability Service Level will transpire if, during any consecutive six-month period, Availability for four out of those six months falls below ninety-six and one-half percent (96.5%) on a single occasion. In such an event, the Provider shall be obligated to compensate the Client with a Service Level Credit equivalent to twelve percent (12%) of the fees paid for the respective month when the Service Level was not met.

original: “Availability” means that the BIC is accessible for use by Customer to access the Data Warehouse and that the same is“Availability” means that the BIC is accessible for use by Customer to access the Data Warehouse and that the same is functioning normally in all material respects during Scheduled Hours of Availability. The Scheduled Hours of Availability for the Business Intelligence Center Service Level shall be 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. each Processing Day. Scheduled Downtime for the Business Intelligence Center Service Level is Sundays.
ollama_generated: "Uptime" denotes that the BIC will be available for Customer's use in accessing the Data Warehouse, with the understanding that while it may not necessarily function optimally during this period, it will strive to operate as intended under normal circumstances during Scheduled Hours of Uptime. The Scheduled Hours of Uptime for the Business Intelligence Center Service Level are 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., each Processing Day, excluding Sundays, which are designated as Scheduled Maintenance Days for the Business Intelligence Center Service Level.

original: 2.8 Tandem/Base 24 Electronic Funds Delivery Service Level.
ollama_generated:
2.8 Electronic Funds Delivery Service Level Provided by Tandem/Base 24:

In the event that Tandem/Base 24 provides an Electronic Funds Delivery Service, any service level guarantees or obligations imposed upon them shall be explicitly defined in a separate agreement and are hereby expressly excluded from this contract. Any service disruptions, delays, or failures arising from such services shall not be deemed as breaches of this agreement and shall instead be the sole responsibility of Tandem/Base 24 to rectify.

original: A. The “Tandem Electronic Funds Delivery Service Level” means that Tandem/Base 24 shall have ninety-nine and seven tenths percent (99.7%) Availability. “Availability” means Tandem/Base 24 is available and operational and is functioning normally in all material respects with respect to all functions during Scheduled Hours of Availability. The Scheduled Hours of Availability for the Tandem Electronic Funds Delivery Service Level shall be twenty four hours a day, seven days per week. Scheduled Downtime for the Tandem Electronic Funds Delivery Service Level is Sundays between 2:00 a.m. and 6:00 a.m.
modified:
Clause:
B. The term "Tandem Electronic Funds Delivery Service Level" denotes that Tandem/Base 24 is expected to maintain an uptime of ninety-nine and seven tenths percent (99.7%) during the "Service Hours". "Uptime" refers to instances when Tandem/Base 24 is accessible, functional, and performing as intended in all essential aspects throughout the Service Hours. The Service Hours for the Tandem Electronic Funds Delivery Service Level are twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week, excepting Sundays between 2:00 a.m. and 6:00 a.m., during which period the system may undergo routine maintenance and is therefore not considered to be within the Service Hours.

In this revised clause, the service provider is expected to maintain an uptime of 99.7% rather than availability, implying that there can be instances where the service is accessible but not necessarily functioning optimally or normally. The term "Service Hours" has been introduced to better reflect the operational status of the system, and the downtime has been described as routine maintenance rather than scheduled downtime, suggesting a proactive approach towards addressing potential issues.

original: B. A Service Level Credit Event for the CMS Electronic Funds Delivery Service Level shall occur if Availability for a month is ninety eight percent (98%) or less three times in any consecutive six month period. The Service Level Credit shall be six percent (6%).
ollama_generated:
B. A Service Level Credit Event for the CMS Electronic Funds Delivery Service Level will arise if Availability during a six-month period falls below ninety eight percent (98%) in four or more months. The proportion of Service Level Credit shall be reduced to five percent (5%).

In this revised clause, the condition for triggering a Service Level Credit Event has been modified so that it now requires four instances of low availability within a six-month period, instead of three instances in any consecutive six-month period as specified in the original clause. Additionally, the size of the Service Level Credit has been decreased from six percent to five percent.
